topic: Deep dive: _collections standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _collections standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: Collections Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: An overview of the enhancements and new features introduced to the collections standard library module in Python 3.12+.
key_points: Introduction of the new deque-based container Dequeue for efficient addition and removal at both ends.
Addition of the OrderedDict class that preserves insertion order while providing dictionary methods like popitem(), clear(), and copy()
Improvements to the Counter class, including a new MostCommon method and updated most_common(n) method for returning n most common elements.
Update to the ChainMap class, allowing it to handle missing mappings gracefully and providing more flexible merging options.
Various bug fixes and performance improvements across the module.

code_examples.code:
from collections.deque import Deque

d = Deque(['a', 'b', 'c'])
d.append('d')
d.popleft()

version_notes: Features and improvements introduced specifically in Python 3.12.
For previous changes, refer to the respective release notes for Python 3.10 and 3.11.
caveats: Some of these new features may not be backward compatible with earlier versions of Python, so ensure compatibility when upgrading or porting code.
As always, it's essential to thoroughly test any updated codebases before deploying them in production.
